page.title: 19Woolley Show
page.content: The{Woolley Moor Vegetable Society} has about 20 members on the committee. Each year they organise the{Woolley {Moor Show}which is held on the last Saturday in August in the field behind the{New Napoleon Inn}which overlooks Ogston Reservoir. Local people enter produce which is displayed in two marquees. There are adult classes for garden produce, home produce and wine. The children's classes are wild flowers and miniature gardens. Winners receive cups which were presented this year by the President,{Miss Joan Jackson.} The Women's Institute serve teas. Music is provided by Ashover Brass Band and a fairground organ. There are sideshows which include skittles, coconut shy, aerial slide, archery and bingo. In the evening there is a tug of war.
